Introduction: Oh, pardon me. I didn't mean to startle you; I was just cataloging the local mosses.$h#$b#I'm Thistle.
Spring_Mon: Everything is waking up. It's noisy. Roots stretching, seeds cracking... do you hear it?
Spring_Tue: The Wizard is allergic to pollen. I saw him sneezing on his telescope earlier. It was objectively hilarious.$h
Spring_Wed: Don't step on the new shoots. They have a right to grow, same as you.
Spring_Thu: I'm looking for morels. If you find any, don't just trample them.
Spring_Fri: Linus is airing out his tent. I should probably do the same.
Spring_Sat: The air smells like wet dirt. It's the best perfume in the world.
Spring_Sun: I saw a fairy last night near your farm. Or a very large firefly.
Summer_Mon: The sun is too loud today. Yes, loud. It screams at the leaves.
Summer_Tue: If you see any tourists from the city littering... tell me. I have a curse for that.$a
Summer_Wed: The river is warm. Too warm. The fish are sluggish.
Summer_Thu: I found a patch of red mushrooms. Don't eat them. Or do, if you want to see colors that don't exist.
Summer_Fri: I'm brewing a cooling tonic. It tastes like bog water, but it works.
Summer_Sat: This heat makes people agitated. You should go stand in the shade before you say something stupid.
Summer_Sun: Fireflies are just stars that got tired of the sky and came down for a visit.
Fall_Mon: Finally. The world is dying, and it is beautiful.$h
Fall_Tue: The pumpkins are happy. I can hear them humming.
Fall_Wed: My hat? It's practical. Keeps the rain off, stores snacks in the brim.
Fall_Thu: Be careful near the deep woods. The shadows get longer this time of year.
Fall_Fri: I need more hazelnuts. The squirrels are stealing my stash.
Fall_Sat: Spirit's Eve is coming. The veil is thin. Don't look into mirrors in the dark.
Fall_Sun: The wind whispers names. Hopefully not yours.
Winter_Mon: Silence. Pure, cold silence. It's my favorite song.
Winter_Tue: The snow covers the ugly parts of civilization. It's an improvement.
Winter_Wed: If you're cold, put on a sweater. Don't come whining to me.
Winter_Thu: I saw a Winter Root moving on its own today. I let it go.
Winter_Fri: Do you think the trees get lonely when they sleep? No, me neither.
Winter_Sat: The Wizard stays locked in his tower. Coward. The cold is bracing.
Winter_Sun: I'm making tea from pine needles. Want some? It's... acquired taste.
EggFestival: I'm only here to make sure no one steps on the rare clovers during the hunt.$s
FlowerDance: Why must they dance like that? It's unnatural. The flowers are embarrassed for them.
Luau: I put a special herb in the soup. Don't worry, it's not poison. It just makes you see sideways for an hour.$h
DanceOfJellies: This... this is acceptable. Quiet. Bioluminescent. Good.
StardewValleyFair: Games. Noise. Clutter. I'm going to go hide behind the grange displays.
SpiritsEve: This maze is amateur work. I could trap you in a loop for a century with three twigs and a pebble.$h
FestivalOfIce: Ice is just water that learned to stand still. I respect that discipline.
FeastOfTheWinterStar: Gifts? Fine. But if anyone gives me plastic, I will turn them into a toad.$a
